name: Goofy Gauntlet
description: A twist on the classic dungeon crawler. Players take control of a fire-spitting goblin, clearing their dungeon of adventurers while reclaiming stolen treasure. I developed this game on my own over the course of a semester using Unity.

name: Stellar Standoff
description: A party game for android devices. Up to eight players duke it out over one valuable asteroid by making strategic commands and passing the phone. <cite>Stellar Standoff</cite> was developed in Unity by a team of six. I helped design, program, and provide art.

name: Knight Move 3D
description: A 3D recreation of Alexey Pajitnov's 1990 puzzle game 'Knight Move.' Players must maneuver their knight piece around a perilous board, pursuing hearts and avoiding the rival rook. <cite>Knight Move 3D</cite> was developed using C++ and OpenGL by a team of three. I was one of two programmers on the project

name: VRn't
description: A satirical arcade game playable in browser. Take control of a gamer with a new VR game and help him win without wrecking his living room. <cite>VRn't</cite> was developed in Unity over the course 72 hours for the Ludum Dare 41 game jam, where it ranked among the top 20 games in 'Humor.' I helped program, design, and write on a team of four

name: Space Station Scoober
description: An experimental action arcade game playable in browser. Make your way through an alien-infested moonbase with your trusty blaster while taking cover behind downed enemies. I developed this game on my own using the Pico-8 game engine.

name: Sugarplum Summit
description: A 'cute 'em up' game playable in browser. Fly up a carefully defended Christmas tree to defeat the evil awaiting at the top, taking care to rescue trapped angels along the way. <cite>Sugarplum Summit</cite> was developed in Unity over the course of 72 hours for the Ludum Dare 40 game jam. I designed, drew, and animated all sprites in addition to co-designing the game on a team of three.

name: Antiqua
description: An illustrated self-published collection of my poetry. Available for purchase online in a digital format.

name: Shapeshift Crypt
description: A 'Binding of Isaac' styled game created over a semester in a group of four students with the Monogame game engine. I was responsible for all visual aspects of the game (UI, sprite work, art direction, animation, graphics programming) and assisted in gameplay design.
